tit.j: 武井龍三プロダクション

sen.j: 武井龍三プロダクション（たけいりゅうぞう-、1929年2月 設立 - 解散）は、かつて京都に存在した映画会社である。
sen.e: Takei Ryuzo Production (established and dissolved in February 1929) is a film company which existed in Kyoto.
Takei Ryuzo Productions (established and dissolved in February 1929) was a film company located in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: Production > Productions; is > was; which existed > located
sen.e: Takei Ryuzo Productions (established and dissolved in February 1929) was a film company located in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 1928年（昭和2年）4月にマキノ・プロダクションを片岡千恵蔵、嵐寛寿郎とともに脱退した俳優武井龍三がその翌年に設立したスタープロダクションであり、貸しスタジオの双ヶ丘撮影所で3本のサイレント映画を製作した。
sen.e: It was a star production established in 1929 by Ryuzo TAKEI, who had left Makino Production with Chiezo KATAOKA and Kanjuro ARASHI in April 1928, and it produced three silent movies in Narabigaoka Studio, a studio for rent.
It was established in 1929 by Ryuzo TAKEI, who had left Makino Productions with Chiezo KATAOKA and Kanjuro ARASHI in April 1928, and produced three silent films in the rentable Narabigaoka Studio.
sen.cmt: eliminated "star production" as this does not carry meaning for me in English; Makino Production > Makino Productions; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: It was established in 1929 by Ryuzo TAKEI, who had left Makino Productions with Chiezo KATAOKA and Kanjuro ARASHI in April 1928, and produced three silent films in the rentable Narabigaoka Studio.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: Takei Pro, for short.
It was commonly referred to as "Takei Pro."
sen.cmt: added quotation marks; fixed to read more consistently with similar articles
sen.e: It was commonly referred to as "Takei Pro."
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 1924年（大正13年）に東亜キネマとの合併前のマキノ映画製作所等持院撮影所に入社、同年7月の合併を経て、翌1925年（大正14年）6月の牧野省三の再独立にあたって、新設のマキノ・プロダクション御室撮影所に移った武井龍三は、同年9月、金森万象監督・寿々喜多呂九平オリジナル脚本の『奇傑鬼鹿毛』全3篇の主役に抜擢されてデビューした。
sen.e: Ryuzo TAKEI, having joined Makino Eiga seisaku-jo Tojiin Studio in 1924 before the merger with Toa Kinema and moved to Omuro Movie Studio of Makino Production, which was newly established after the merger in July 1924 and Shozo MAKINO's separation from the merged company in June 1925, made his debut in September that year when he was selected as the leading character of all of the three episodes of "Kiketsu Onikage"(Great Onikage) directed by Bansho KANAMORI, which were based on the original screenplay written by Rokuhei SUSUKITA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Ryuzo TAKEI, having joined Makino Eiga Seisaku-jo Tojiin Studio in 1924 before the merger with Toa Kinema and moving to Makino Productions' Omuro Movie Studio, which was newly established after the merger in July 1924 and Shozo MAKINO's separation from the merged company in June 1925, made his debut in September that year when he was selected as the leading character in all three episodes of "Kiketsu Onikage"(Great Onikage) directed by Bansho KANAMORI and based on the original screenplay written by Rokuhei SUSUKITA.
sen.cmt: fixed to read more naturally
sen.e: Ryuzo TAKEI, having joined Makino Eiga Seisaku-jo Tojiin Studio in 1924 before the merger with Toa Kinema and moving to Makino Productions' Omuro Movie Studio, which was newly established after the merger in July 1924 and Shozo MAKINO's separation from the merged company in June 1925, made his debut in September that year when he was selected as the leading character in all three episodes of "Kiketsu Onikage"(Great Onikage) directed by Bansho KANAMORI and based on the original screenplay written by Rokuhei SUSUKITA.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかし、1928年（昭和3年）4月の片岡千恵蔵、嵐寛寿郎、山口俊雄 (新派俳優)、中根龍太郎、市川小文治、山本礼三郎らスター俳優の集団退社のさいに、ともに退社した。
sen.e: However, when star actors including Chiezo KATAOKA, Kanjuro ARASHI, Toshio YAMAGUCHI (an actor belonging to Shinpa-Geki), Ryutaro NAKANE, Kobunji ICHIKAWA and Reizaburo YAMAMOTO left the company in a group in April 1928, he left with those actors.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, when star actors including Chiezo KATAOKA, Kanjuro ARASHI, Toshio YAMAGUCHI (an actor belonging to Shinpa-Geki), Ryutaro NAKANE, Kobunji ICHIKAWA and Reizaburo YAMAMOTO left the company in a group in April of 1928, TAKEI resigned as well.
sen.cmt: he left with those actors > TAKEI resigned as well
sen.e: However, when star actors including Chiezo KATAOKA, Kanjuro ARASHI, Toshio YAMAGUCHI (an actor belonging to Shinpa-Geki), Ryutaro NAKANE, Kobunji ICHIKAWA and Reizaburo YAMAMOTO left the company in a group in April of 1928, TAKEI resigned as well.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: その背景には、山崎徳次郎による「日本活動常設館館主連盟映画配給本社」の設立、マキノを退社した河合広始と田中十三による京都・双ヶ丘の貸しスタジオ「日本キネマ撮影所」（双ヶ丘撮影所）の設立があった。
sen.e: Such a move was partly motivated by the formation of "Nihon Katsudo Josetsukan Kanshu Renmei Eiga Haikyu Honsha" (Headquarters of Eiga Haikyu for association of masters of movie theaters in Japan) by Tokujiro YAMAZAKI as well as by the establishment of "Japan Cinema Studio" (Narabigaoka Studio), a studio for rent in Narabigaoka, Kyoto, by Hiroshi KAWAI and Juzo TANAKA, who had left Makino, and TAKEI joined "Kataoka Chiezo Production" (Chie Pro) established in May.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処設立があり、→設立があった。
sen.e: TAKEI's decision to resign was partly motivated by the formation of "Nihon Katsudo Josetsukan Kanshu Renmei Eiga Haikyu Honsha" (Distribution Company Headquarters for Movie Theater Owners in Japan) (also known as "Kanshu Renmei" [the Theater Owner's Association]) by Tokujiro YAMAZAKI, as well as by the establishment of former Makino members Hiroshi KAWAI and Juzu TANAKA's studio-for-rent "Japan Kinema Studio" (Narabigaoka Studio) in Narabigaoka, Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処changed description for "Nihon Katsudo…"; added comma after "YAMAZAKI";
sen.e: TAKEI's decision to resign was partly motivated by the formation of "Nihon Katsudo Josetsukan Kanshu Renmei Eiga Haikyu Honsha" (Distribution Company Headquarters for Movie Theater Owners in Japan) (also known as "Kanshu Renmei" [the Theater Owner's Association]) by Tokujiro YAMAZAKI, as well as by the establishment of former Makino members Hiroshi KAWAI and Juzu TANAKA's studio-for-rent "Japan Kinema Studio" (Narabigaoka Studio) in Narabigaoka, Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 5月に設立された「片岡千恵蔵プロダクション」（千恵プロ）に武井は入社した。
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: TAKEI joined "Kataoka Chiezo Productions" (Chie Pro) established in May of 1928.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処added "of 1928"
sen.e: TAKEI joined 'Kataoka Chiezo Productions' (Chie Pro) established in May of 1928.
sen.cmt: " "を' 'に変更しました。

sen.j: 先陣を切って同年5月16日に双ヶ丘撮影所でクランクインした千恵プロ作品『天下太平記』に、市川小文治らとともに出演、同作は同年6月15日に「館主連盟」の配給で公開された。
sen.e: With Kobunji ICHIKAWA and others, he acted in a film titled "Tenka Taiheiki" (Peace on Earth) produced by Chie Pro, the first movie to be shot in Narabigaoka Studio (the shooting started on May 16, 1928), and the movie was distributed and released by "Kanshu Renmei" on June 15 that year.

Along with Kobunji ICHIKAWA and a number of other actors, TAKEI acted in the film titled "Tenka Taiheiki" (Peace on Earth) produced by Chie Pro, the first film to be shot in Narabigaoka Studio (filming started on May 16, 1928), and the movie was distributed and released by "Kanshu Renmei" on June 15, 1928.
sen.cmt: and others > and a number of other actors; he > TAKEI; the first movie > the first film; the shooting started > filming started; on June 15 of that year > on June 15, 1928
sen.e: Along with Kobunji ICHIKAWA and a number of other actors, TAKEI acted in the film titled "Tenka Taiheiki" (Peace on Earth) produced by Chie Pro, the first film to be shot in Narabigaoka Studio (filming started on May 16, 1928), and the movie was distributed and released by 'Kanshu Renmei' on June 15, 1928.
sen.cmt: " "を' 'に変更しました。

sen.j: 7月末で「館主連盟」が崩壊、嵐寛寿郎プロダクション（第1次寛プロ）らはみな撤退、俳優も監督も、マキノ以外のメジャー撮影所や舞台演劇に散っていった。
sen.e: At the end of July "Kanshu Renmei" fell apart, and as a result of the complete closure of Arashi Kanjuro Production (The First Kan Pro) all the actors and directors broke away and joined various major studios (other than Makino) and living theaters, but Chie Pro shot six movies in 1928 and built another studio in Sagano in 1929.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処散っていったが、→散っていった。
sen.e: "Kanshu Renmei" fell apart at the end of July, resulting in the complete closure of Arashi Kanjuro Productions (the first period of Kan Pro) and all of the actors and directors went different ways, joining various major studios (other than Makino) and live theaters.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処rearranged sentence to read more naturally; split into two cells since this sentence ran on too long
sen.e: Kanshu Renmei' fell apart at the end of July, resulting in the complete closure of Arashi Kanjuro Productions (the first period of Kan Pro) and all of the actors and directors went different ways, joining various major studios (other than Makino) and live theaters.
sen.cmt: "を' 'に変更しました。原文で、後列との重複部分を削除しました。

sen.j: しかし、千恵プロは同年内に6本を撮り、年明け1929年（昭和4年）には嵯峨野に撮影所を建設する。
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処added しかし、
sen.e: Chie Pro, however, continued on to shoot six films in 1928 and built an additional studio in Sagano in 1929.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処fixed to read more naturally
sen.e: Chie Pro, however, continued on to shoot six films in 1928 and built an additional studio in Sagano in 1929.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 千恵プロ製作の合計9本に出演した武井は、同年2月、同社を退社、設立したのがこの「武井龍三プロダクション」（武井プロ）である。
sen.e: After acting in nine movies in total produced by Chie Pro, TAKEI left the production in February that year and established this "Takei Ryuzo Production" (Takei Pro).
After acting in nine movies in total produced by Chie Pro, TAKEI left the production in February of 1929 and established "Takei Ryuzo Production" (Takei Pro).
sen.cmt: eliminated "this" after "established"; February of that year > February of 1929
sen.e: After acting in nine movies in total produced by Chie Pro, TAKEI left the production in February of 1929 and established 'Takei Ryuzo Production' (Takei Pro).
sen.cmt: "を' 'に変更しました。

sen.j: 「武井プロ」は、同1929年に河合・田中の双ヶ丘撮影所に設立され、『金剛呪文』前・後篇、『仇討双人録』の3本のサイレント映画を製作、いずれも失敗に終わる。
sen.e: In 1929 "Takei Pro" was established in Narabigaoka Studio operated by KAWAI and TANAKA, and produced three silent movies, the first and sequel parts of "Kongo jumon" (literally, vajra spell) and "Adauchi futari roku" (literally, two persons' record of vengeance), all of which were a failure.

"Takei Pro" was established in 1929 in the Narabigaoka Studio, operated by KAWAI and TANAKA, and produced the three silent films "Adauchi Futari Roku" (literally, "two persons' record of vengeance"), "Kongo Jumon" and a sequel, all of which became failures.
sen.cmt: rearranged sentence to read more smoothly; eliminated (literally, vajra spell);
sen.e: Takei Pro' was established in 1929 in the Narabigaoka Studio, operated by KAWAI and TANAKA, and produced the three silent films "Adauchi Futari Roku" (literally, "two persons' record of vengeance"), "Kongo Jumon" and a sequel, all of which became failures.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」の部分を' 'に変更さしました。

sen.j: 作品の詳細についての記録も残っていない。
sen.e: There is no record of details of those movies.
There is no detailed record of these films.
sen.cmt: fixed to read more naturally
sen.e: There is no detailed record of these films.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 双ヶ丘撮影所は「武井プロ」の終焉をもって、しばらく閉鎖されることになる。
sen.e: With the demise of "Takei Pro," Narabigaoka Studio was also closed down for an undefined period.
With the demise of "Takei Pro," Narabigaoka Studio was also closed down for an undefined period.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: With the demise of 'Takei Pro,' Narabigaoka Studio was also closed down for an undefined period.
sen.cmt: "を' 'に変更しました。

sen.j: 武井は地方巡業を経て、翌1930年（昭和5年）6月、市川右太衛門プロダクションに入社することになる。
sen.e: After some regional tours, TAKEI joined Ichikawa Utakemon Production in June, 1930.
After a number of regional tours, TAKEI joined Ichikawa Utakemon Productions in June of 1930.
sen.cmt: some > a number of; Production > Productions; June, 1930 > June of 1930
sen.e: After a number of regional tours, TAKEI joined Ichikawa Utaemon Productions in June of 1930.
sen.cmt: UtakemonをUtaemonに変更しました。
